topic.title: Dictionary proposal merge function is not implemented properly

body.p: Change 1 - Displaying single source terms: In the previous dictionary display within the editor, the display for a single source term may show several duplicate head term entries, each listing the same or different translated terms. The translated terms may have the same or different product identifiers or comments. The new implementation will merge these multiple entries into a single head term entry, where each translated term is listed only once, with its product identifiers and comments merged together. This will compress the head term entry into a smaller area, and allow more terms to be listed for long segments. The dictionary lookup window can still be used to display the original entry's information.

Change 2 - Copying terms when more than 52 terms are listed: In the previous dictionary display within the editor, only the first 52 (or less) translated terms could be easily copied using a hot key (like Ctrl+a). If there were more than 52 (or less) terms, they were identified with an asterisk '*' and could not be copied using a hot key. The new implementation allows the user to define a special hot key to page down/up the hot key assignments to either the next or the previous group of terms. This will allow all terms to be easily copied using a Ctrl+x hot key (where x is the user defined key). Keys are defined while being in the translation editor. Go to "Options", "Keys...", and in the panel "Assign Keys" locate e.g. "Scroll disctionary down".
